sub_topic: Calculating the volume of a rectangular pyramid.
message_1: A pyramid has a rectangular base with a length of 10 cm and a width of 8 cm. The height of the pyramid is 6 cm. Find the volume of the rectangular pyramid in cubic centimeters.
message_2:
To find the volume of a pyramid with a rectangular base, we can use the formula:

Volume = (1/3) * Base Area * Height

The base area of the rectangular pyramid can be found by multiplying the length and width of the base:

Base Area = Length * Width
Base Area = 10 cm * 8 cm
Base Area = 80 square centimeters

Now, we can plug the base area and height into the volume formula:

Volume = (1/3) * 80 cmÂ² * 6 cm
Volume = (1/3) * 480 cubic centimeters
Volume = 160 cubic centimeters

The volume of the rectangular pyramid is 160 cubic centimeters.
